meanings.definition: The act of circulating or flowing again.
meanings.sent1: The recirculations of water in the pond help keep the fish healthy.
meanings.sent2: The recirculations of air in the room make it feel fresh and clean.
meanings.sent3: The recirculations of jokes among friends always bring laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like recirculations, constantly returning to the same worries.
meanings.sent5: The recirculations of memories in her mind painted a vivid picture of the past.

meanings.definition: The process of moving something in a closed circuit or loop.
meanings.sent1: The recirculations of the toy train delighted the children at the party.
meanings.sent2: The recirculations of blood in our bodies are essential for survival.
meanings.sent3: The recirculations of the rumor around the office were amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The recirculations of energy in the ecosystem sustain all living beings.
meanings.sent5: The recirculations of music in the concert hall created a mesmerizing atmosphere.
